column4: i doubt update-rc.d should be used on ubuntu, as ubuntu uses upstart...  just sayin'
AdvoWork: thats why i suggested sysv-rc-conf, which handles this correct (afaik)         just saying ;)
/etc/init.d is SYSV - NOT upstart!  /etc/init/ is upstart.
yes, but sysv-rc-conf handles old sysv-links in a upstart-pleasant way (in opposite to updae-rc.d)
